repnme.cdata!:
Mauritius - Industrial and Vocational
            Training Project, Education Sector Development Project, and
            Higher and Technical Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
All three projects are rated
            unsatisfactory or marginally unsatisfactory. All three
            projects stressed the importance of involving stakeholders
            to build consensus around sector policies. Other lessons
            learned from the Industrial and Vocational Training Project
            are: Agents and procedures for project coordination can
            accelerate procurement in slow disbursing projects.
            Clearly-defined procedures are essential for appraising
            sub-projects during implementation. Time-bound, monitorable
            performance indicators are important to guiding
            implementation and measuring achievement of objectives. Key
            lessons from the Education Sector Development Project are:
            Projects will fail if little attention is paid to
            implementation. Frequent changes in personnel, including
            roles and responsibilities, impede achievement of objectives
            on higher levels. Improving learning achievements requires a
            holistic and integrated approach, which goes beyond the
            measurement of quantitative inputs. Lessons learned from the
            Higher and Technical Education Project are: To keep
            implementation on schedule, the Bank has to establish
            ownership of the project at national and institutional
            levels. The government and the Bank should first insist on
            sound sectoral and sub-sectoral policies before investing in
            such projects. Project objectives need to be scaled to take
            account of the local implementation capacity. Procurement
            procedures need to be harmonized. Statutes of the governing
            councils and education boards need updating.

repnme.cdata!: Mauritius - Higher and Technical Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Higher and Technical Education
            Project will support the Government's education sector
            program for higher and polytechnic education, which aims to
            produce the human resources required to support a more
            competitive economy. The project will assist the
            Government's program by: (a) strengthening the
            University of Mauritius, and (b) rationalizing polytechnic education.
